overview: Fabrice Champion was an internationally recognized trapeze artist. During a rehearsal, he became quadriplegic following a collision in flight. For years, Fabrice tried different therapies. While teaching in the National Circus Schools, he met Matias and Alexandre, two acrobatic students. Together, they invented the first "tetra-acrobatic" choreographies. For Fabrice, it was the beginning of a new way to live with his paralysis. For Alexandre and Matias, it was the beginning of a new approach to their discipline.
title: Parade
